newsitem.title: DUBAI: Emirates Industrial Bank raises financing ceiling.
newsitem.headline: Emirates Industrial Bank raises financing ceiling.

text.p: Emirates Industrial Bank (EIB) on Tuesday agreed to raise the ceiling of its share in financing industrial projects in the Gulf Arab state, the official news agency WAM reported.

Under changes approved at a general assembly, EIB increased its financing ceiling to 70 percent of the project's cost or a maximum equal to 20 percent of the bank's authorised capital and reserves, whichever is lower.
Previously, the bank limited financing to 60 percent of a project's cost.
It said this would boost EIB's role in financing industrial projects and increasing its share in UAE investments.
It agreed to finance three new projects worth 18.3 million dirhams ($5 million) in 1997.
In 1996 the bank's capital stood at 731 million dirhams while profits in the year were 1.7 million dirhams.

The government holds 51 percent and local banks and insurance firms hold the rest of EIB, which has helped finance 254 projects worth 1.4 billion dirhams since it was set up in 1982 to promote manufacturing and non-oil industrial projects.
